intro: Cnemidaria quitensis, commonly known as the Andean grasshopper plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique ecological role and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
